SumOfProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Description1Txt: WEINGART FOUNDATION MADE A LOAN TO THE STEP UP ON SECOND STREET, INC. TO SUPPORT PAYROLL, TRAINING, AND OPERATIONAL INFRASTRUCTURE COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH CONVERTING MOTEL UNITS TO PERMANENT HOUSING IN SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA.

ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.FormAndInfoAndMaterialsTxt: GRANTS AND OTHER PROGRAM SUPPORT ARE DESIGNED TO IMPROVE THE CAPACITY AND SUSTAINABILITY OF ORGANIZATIONS TO ACHIEVE THEIR MISSIONS IN THE AREAS OF HEALTH, HUMAN SERVICES, & EDUCATION. WE GIVE THE HIGHEST PRIORITY TO ACTIVITIES THAT PROVIDE GREATER ACCESS TO PEOPLE WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AND UNDERSERVED. OF PARTICULAR INTEREST TO THE FOUNDATION ARE APPLICATIONS THAT SPECIFICALLY ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME CHILDREN, OLDER ADULTS, & PEOPLE AFFECTED BY DISABILITIES AND HOMELESSNESS. THE FOUNDATION ALSO FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT BENEFIT THE GENERAL COMMUNITY & IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL INDIVIDUALS IN SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA. GRANTS ARE AWARDED FOR THE PERIOD OF TIME NECESSARY TO COMPLETE THE PROPOSED OUTCOMES, WITH MOST GRANTS RANGING BETWEEN ONE AND TWO YEARS. GENERALLY, GRANTEES MUST WAIT ONE YEAR FROM THE END OF THEIR GRANT PERIOD BEFORE REAPPLYING FOR A NEW GRANT.
ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.SubmissionDeadlinesTxt: REGULAR GRANT PROGRAM AND SMALL GRANTS PROGRAM DO NOT HAVE DEADLINES.
ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.RestrictionsOnAwardsTxt: GRANTS ARE NOT MADE TO ORGANIZATIONS THAT DISCRIMINATE AGAINST CERTAIN GROUPS OR INDIVIDUALS IN THE DELIVERY OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICES ON THE BASIS OF RACE, RELIGION, NATIONAL ORIGIN, GENDER, AGE, SEXUAL ORIENTATION OR DISABILITY; FOR PROPAGANDIZING, INFLUENCING LEGISLATION AND/OR ELECTIONS, PROMOTING VOTER REGISTRATION; FOR POLITICAL CANDIDATES, POLITICAL CAMPAIGNS; FOR LITIGATION; FOR SOCIAL OR POLITICAL ISSUES OUTSIDE THE U.S.; TO INDIVIDUALS; FOR CONFERENCES, WORKSHOPS, TEMPORARY EXHIBITS, TRAVEL, SURVEYS, FILMS OR PUBLISHING ACTIVITIES; FOR ENDOWMENT FUNDS; FOR DEFICITS OR DEBT REDUCTION; FOR FUNDRAISING DINNERS OR EVENTS; FOR RESEARCH. GRANTS GENERALLY ARE NOT APPROVED FOR NATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS THAT DO NOT HAVE LOCAL CHAPTERS OPERATING IN THE GEOGRAPHIC AREA OF GRANT FOCUS.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: STRATEGIC ACTIONS FOR A JUST ECONOMY

GeneralExplanationGrp.MediumExplanationTxt: NOTES RECEIVABLE-STUDENT LOAN PROGRAMDURING FISCAL YEAR 1987, THE FOUNDATION IMPLEMENTED ASTUDENT LOAN PROGRAM TO BE FUNDED OVER 13 YEARS FROM 1987THROUGH 1999, WHEREBY THE FOUNDATION AGREED TO MAKE NONINTERESTBEARING LOANS TO QUALIFYING COLLEGES, TO BE USEDFOR INTEREST-FREE STUDENT LOANS. IN ADDITION, THE FOUNDATIONPROVIDED GRANTS TO MATCH FUNDS RAISED FROM OUTSIDE SOURCESUP TO THE AMOUNT OF THE LOANS THROUGH 1991. THE FOUNDATIONENTERED INTO AGREEMENTS WITH 14 QUALIFYING COLLEGES. AS OFJUNE 30, 1999, HAS PROVIDED $53,275,446 TO THESE COLLEGES.THE FOUNDATION MADE ITS FINAL COMMITMENTS WITH RESPECT TOTHIS PROGRAM AS OF JUNE 30, 2006. THE INTERNAL REVENUESERVICE HAS ISSUED A DETERMINATION LETTER WHICH ALLOWS THEFOUNDATION TO TREAT THE LOANS TO THE COLLEGE AS GRANTS.AS FURTHER SUPPORT TO THE STUDENT LOAN PROGRAM, THEFOUNDATION COMMITTED TO MATCH WITH $1 OF CASH AND $2 OF LOANFORGIVENESS FOR EACH $3 SECURED BY THE PARTICIPATING SCHOOLSBETWEEN JANUARY 1, 1992 AND DECEMBER 31, 1996, UP TO AMAXIMUM OF $28,058,334, WHICH REPRESENTS THE TOTAL AMOUNT TOBE LOANED TO THE SCHOOLS OVER THE 14 YEAR PERIOD BEGINNINGIN 1987. THE SCHOOLS WERE ALLOWED TO MEET THE MATCH WITHFUNDS IRREVOCABLY COMMITTED TO THE FUND BUT UNCOLLECTED ASOF THE DEADLINE DATE.FOUR SCHOOLS HAVE PLEDGES FOR FUTURE GIFTS, WHICH WOULDREQUIRE THE FOUNDATION TO MATCH A TOTAL OF $1,583,805 AS THEGIFTS ARE MADE THROUGH DECEMBER 2016. THE FOUNDATION'SULTIMATE GRANT TOTAL FOR THIS PROGRAM WILL BE APPROXIMATELY$55,000,000.
